lead_paragraph: In a country where nearly a third of young people are unemployed, the jobless in Kasserine have occupied part of the governor’s office and declared a hunger strike.

headline.print_headline: Tunisian Town Simmers Over Unemployment and Lack of Opportunity
headline.main: Tunisian Town Simmers With Unrest Over Lack of Jobs and Investment

snippet: In a country where nearly a third of young people are unemployed, the jobless in Kasserine have occupied part of the governor’s office and declared a hunger strike.
abstract: Unemployed Tunisian youths protest government's failure to deliver on promise of 2011 revolution; death of demonstrator in provincial capital of Kasserine leads to occupation of governor's office by college graduates demanding jobs and easy access to bank loans; government promises to rectify situation, while likening protesters to Islamic militants.
